intro: Tithymalus meyeri, commonly known as the Meyer's tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Tithymalus meyeri is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
